result.execSummary:
The defendant Trevor J. Kula was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay $500.00 fine plus costs and Department of Corrections Supervision Fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
--------------------------------

Pay restitution in the amount of $6,300.00. Restitution is joint and several with co-actor and is subject to the Defendant's right to challenge.
--------------------------------
**AMENDMENT 02-09-2015 - PURSUANT TO STIPULATION OF THE PARTIES AND BY ORDER OF THE COURT, restitution is set at $5,000.00 joint and several with co-actor Kirklend Krause (2013CF000452). Restitution has been paid in full and disbursed to the victim through the Clerk of Courts Office.
--------------------------------

No contact with the victim without the victim's and Probation Agent's consent.  No alcohol.  No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
--------------------------------

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
--------------------------------
AODA assessment and counseling as recommended.

timeConds.notes: with work release privileges to commence on or before December 19, 2014 @ 8;00 am.

10:48 am
 Defendant Kirklend K Krause in court with attorney Melissa Anne Frost. Prosecuting Attorney Haley J. Rea for the State appears. Victim Lawrence Yopp in court. Attorney Melissa Nepomiachi appears in court with Trevor Kula. 
Atty Frost states there is an agreement. Her client will accept the agreement of $5000. 
Atty Nepomiachi states that is the agreement of her client as well.
Agreement by Atty Rea. 
Court orders Atty Frost to prepare the order.
Court adjourned.

ak

Defendant Trevor J. Kula in court with attorney Melissa Nepomiachi.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Kirklend K Krause in court with attorney Melissa Anne Frost.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court in session @ 10:37 a.m. - Appearances made. There is no agreement in these matters. Statement by attorney Melissa Frost regarding new information and additional claims that they have just received. Attorney Frost indicates also that she has been trying to locate photographs of the trailers, but has not yet received them. Court finds that based on this new information a new date will need to be set and continues hearing. Matter is continued. State provides the Court with packet of information provided to the attorneys.
Court orders that the State file an amended restitution request form with amended amounts for next hearing.
Court in recess @ 10:45 a.m.
  Restitution hearing scheduled for February 4, 2015 at 10:00 am.
